text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Fabricio a cloud support
engineer at the AWS office here in
Dublin today I'm going to show you how
you can pass temporary collections for
assumed role into the docker runtime
with adobe's code build let's get
started after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the
codebit console
select your project and get the AWS
identity and access management service
role used for the project under the
build details we will need this
information later in these steps
login to the AWS Management console and
then navigate to the island console
select roles and then create the role
let's create the iron role that we want
our Docker runtime to assume with the IM
permissions to the resources that we
want to access and with a trust
relationship to the Colby service role
after it is created copy the arm of the
iron role
in the build spec file of your cold
build project add export commands to
create the variables containing the iron
role credentials that are passed to the
docker runtime as well as the Arn of the
iron role previously created
update your bills back and run your code
build project
and now we can see the docker runtime
accessing your AWS Resources with the
iron role that we created please note
that it is within the docker file at the
source of the projects where the adobe's
command which levels the assumed role
are specified
so now you know how you can pass in
priority cases for a central into the
docker runtime with cold build thanks
for watching a Happy Cloud computer from
all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
